Be Aware! Watch Out With Those Peppers!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Items, Accessories, Foods: Be Aware! Watch Out With Those Peppers!
By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, February 19, 2002 - 10:12 pm:

I have been testing lifespans of monsters, and helping with completing the techs charts, so I have been raising a lot of monsters that do nothing but sleep. Now these all sleep monsters should spend their lives stress & fatigue free...or so I thought...

Anyway, I have noticed something interesting about foods. With almost every food, including "nothing", after feeding, my monster was always "full of energy". Remember that it had rested its whole life, including the week before the feedings. But, when I fed Peppers, I got the message that the monster "is healthy".

I noted this a while back, but waited until I had tested it extensively to publish it. I tried feedings on 14 main breeds. I tried all the variations on like/nutrition (1/1 through 4/4) on all the foods, and as many as possible on each breed. I tested all of the localizing foods with each breed. Also, I made a point to seek out monsters that like Peppers, and was able to see it fed through all values from 1/1 to 4/4 as well.

In every case, only Peppers gave the "is healthy" notice. This is an indication that Peppers actually add a bit of stress/fatigue to your monster. It's the same warning you get after doing one light drill. It may not give as much stress/fatigue as a LD, but it certainly leaves your monster in worse shape after feeding.

Just be aware of the situation, and plan your methods around this fact.

By danz on Wednesday, February 20, 2002 - 08:58 pm:

Dammit! NOTHING likes peppers, and now I see why! It makes it so •••• hard to evolve things into takrama subs tho! Thx for the heads up tho Lisa!

By AgMasamu on Wednesday, February 20, 2002 - 09:02 pm:

Actually, I raised a Ducken that LOVED Peppers. Would the four in Favorites lower the stress/fatigue given?

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, February 20, 2002 - 09:09 pm:

Nope, it's the same no matter what. I tested it on Jokers who tended to have 4/4 or 4/3 for Peppers, exact same result.

Like/Dislike may do more subtle things by changing the "Bonds", but the effect itself is the same regardless of how many boxes are filled, from 1/1 to 4/4. I spent a lot of time checking this before posting.
